content: let it snow let it snow let it snow
hey crafters let's make some snow
[Applause] hey guys here I have my hot wire foam
factory free hand router and I really like this it has a wire that you can
bend into any shape you want alright and this will be really good for working on
the drifts okay so now I'm going to use this styrofoam just regular packing
styrofoam and it's about an inch and I'm just gonna pull through it with the
router the freehand router and I'm gonna kind of do a back and forth motion
because I want let it look like drifting snow right for the snow drifts so just
kind of pull through it like that just cuts through it like butter and Wow look
at that effect really cool effect that's something you couldn't get with the
regular sculpting tool it's now I'll do another one and nice super nice so now
what I'm going to do is cut around with my sculpting tool and I want to get that
excess off of there as well as kind of give it some height right kind of a
gentle slope and a nice a little excess there off I need to here I get my front
slope so nice and you still got that wavy the wavy lines that look like the
drifting snow I really like that I really like that nice effect and here
I'm just using my regular sculpting tool and this is a thinner styrofoam just
thought styrofoam packaging and I really want to use white for this project right
so I'm just gonna kind of do a incline but not too inclined because I don't
want it to be too thin and I'm gonna more up the surface a bit by dragging it
across the surface and that will kind of help you know make it not look like a
table like a flat table right alright easy peasy
alright so there's my snow patch now we're gonna take these to 11 so the
secret to this project is this white sand right this will be perfect for snow
it almost looks like crushed glass it has like
you know a reflection into it and it's just really perfect for this project all
right I've got a kitty litter box here and my sand my white sand I'm gonna use
Mod Podge and squirt it on the surface and paint it on I want to cover the
whole surface with Mod Podge okay it's a little on the front there get that and
then I'll just sprinkle this sand on you want to cover the whole thing up and wow
that is a really cool snow effect yeah I'll do the snow patch here same way
just cover it with the Mod Podge all around and then just sprinkle the sand
on it you want to cover the whole thing remember you want to cover the whole
thing up right there I've done it and the great thing about this is the
styrofoam is all white and the sands all white so you're really you're really
kind of set here right and just really really cool I think these look great I
love the little reflections you get off of that white sand and there we go it's
all dried up and they're nice and hard actually but I'm putting another thin
coat of Mod Podge on here and that'll help just secure the sand to the piece
right so you don't want any loose pieces of sand coming off during your play and
this just gives you an extra reinforcement so Wow we'll just let
these dry up and then we'll hit the table and show you how great these look
here I have my Arctic wasteland and I have Hill Gun Roderick trudging across
it and here you can see my snow drifts they're all kind of going one way
because I imagine the snow blowing one way and it's kind of a slope up and then
I have the snow piles of scattered around and yeah pretty cool but this is
not really the best way to show this story and I think it's better to show it
in some kind of other terrain right so here I feel is the best way to show it
there's this fort that's the door is open and the snow is blown into the fort
and I think it really looks cool you know contrasting with the rest there's
um the snowdrifts and yeah I just love that kind of wavy stuff in the snowdrift
and just looks really cool that sand looks great it makes it really
hard and durable and I didn't have to paint these at all right I just glued
the sand on and just a stand a snow pile there it just really looks great it
reflects the light really looks like snow and poor Roderick and he'll got
trying to get some water with the water's all frozen in the well I also
did like a wagon on its side back there if you see it on the snow drifts so cool
stop let it snow let it snow let it snow I don't care if it's crappy outside my
benches inside so here I am crafting again while it's those wireless knows
while it snows
